page.title: 15Coolham & Shipley/Population
page.content: The small population of the area is concentrated in the villages of Coolham and Shipley, about a mile and a half apart. There are also scattered and sometimes quite isolated farms and cottages. There has been no new development whatsoever for almost a decade since the last new houses were built at King's Platt, Shipley in the mid 1970s. Our survey showed that about 70% of properties are detached. The remaining houses and cottages are all semi-detached and there are no terraced properties. Within the area are to be found widely differing types of property,from a castle, through manor houses, farmhouses and council houses to very small tied cottages. Our survey sample revealed 61% owner occupation, 21% rented property and 18% tied accomodation.
